column2: Military police are concerned with law enforcement (including criminal investigation) on military property and concerning military personnel, installation security, close personal protection of senior military officers, management of prisoners of war, management of military prisons, traffic control, route signing and resupply route management.

A combat engineer, also called pioneer or sapper in many armies, is a soldier who performs a variety of construction and demolition tasks under combat conditions. Such tasks typically include constructing and breaching trenches, tank traps and other fortifications, bunker construction, bridge and road construction or destruction, laying or clearing land mines, and other physical work in the battlefield.

A combat engineer, also called pioneer or sapper in many armies, is a soldier who performs a variety of construction and demolition tasks under combat conditions. Such tasks typically include constructing and breaching trenches, tank traps and other fortifications, bunker construction, bridge and road construction or destruction, laying or clearing land mines, and other physical work in the battlefield.

Garrison is the collective term for a body of troops stationed in a particular location, originally to guard it, but now often simply using it as a home base. The garrison is usually in a city, town, fort, castle or similar.
A militia generally is an army or other fighting force that is composed of non-professional fighters
column3: citizens of a nation or subjects of a state or government that can be called upon to enter a combat situation, as opposed to a professional force of regular, full-time military personnel. Militia are much less effective at fighting large armies but are well trained to deal with urban warfare since usually they have a good knowledge of the surroundings.

column2: Infantry is the branch of a military force that fights on foot — troops specifically trained to engage, fight, and defeat the enemy in face-to-face combat, and thus bear the brunt of warfare, suffering the greatest number of casualties. Historically, as the oldest branch of the combat arms, the infantry are the tip of the spear of a modern army.

Marines, also known as a marine corps or naval infantry, are an infantry force that specializes in the support of naval and army operations on land and at sea, as well as the execution of their own. In the majority of countries, the marine force is part of the navy, but it can also be under the army like the Troupes de marine, or under an independent command like the United States Marine Corps and Royal Marines.

Airborne forces are military units, usually light infantry, set up to be moved by aircraft and "dropped" into battle, typically by parachute. Thus, they can be placed behind enemy lines, and have the capability to deploy almost anywhere with little warning. The formations are limited only by the number and size of their aircraft, so given enough capacity a huge force can appear "out of nowhere" in minutes, an action referred to as vertical envelopment.

Special forces, or special operations forces are military units trained to perform unconventional missions. Special forces, as they would now be recognised, emerged in the early 20th century, with a significant growth in the field during the Second World War.
Infantry unit's battle efficiency rely on capable small arms such as assault rifles and carbines. By spending resources and time on this tech, the units will perform better in combat.
Infantry units are vulnerable to hostile armored opponents. By equipping our infantry battalions with Light Anti Tank weapons, we can stand a much better chance in a potential war.

Carbines and rifles provide precision fire to a fire team but sometimes that is not sufficient. Machineguns and hand-held grenade launchers can provide suppressive fire and raise the general defensive capabilities.

Aerial targets such as attack helicopters or fixed wing aircraft are two serious threats our land units. By equipping our infantry battalions with shoulder-launched anti air weapons, MANPADS, we raise their air defence.
Field engineers can utilize special equipment when crucial bridges have been sabotaged or they are not simply there.
Airborne infantry need good equipment to ensure that their combat jumps/insertions by air go smoothly and with minimal losses.
Marines and Special Forces need a good, stealthy and sturdy way of attacking by sea. Inflatable boats or lightweight Rigid-hulled inflatable boats are two great solutions.

Mountaineers, paratroopers and special forces have to utilize high-performance mountaineering equipment in order to reach their objective. Therefore, this kind of equipment is very important for operations in mountainous areas.

A night vision device (NVD) is an optical instrument that allows images to be produced in levels of light approaching total darkness. They are most often used by the military and law enforcement agencies, but are available to civilian users. The term usually refers to a complete unit, including an image intensifier tube, a protective and generally water-resistant housing, and some type of mounting system.

Communication radios are electromechanical equipment that is used to enhance unit cooperation, even if the two units are miles away. Entire military operations depend on solid communication and cooperation.
GPS powered digital maps allow our troops to receive real time updates regarding the terrain and also to know their own position in relation to an enemy position.

If we want our infantry units to be efficient in all types of terrain they might encounter we need to set up special programs which will allow them to train in these types of terrain and improve their abilities and survival skills.

Urban warfare is combat conducted in urban areas such as towns and cities. Urban combat is very different from combat in the open at both the operational and tactical level. Complicating factors in urban warfare include the presence of civilians and the complexity of the urban terrain.

Mountain warfare refers to warfare in the mountains or similarly rough terrain. This type of warfare is also called Alpine warfare, after the Alps mountains. Mountain warfare is one of the most dangerous types of combat as it involves surviving not only combat with the enemy but also the extreme weather and dangerous terrain.

Jungle warfare is a term used to cover the special techniques needed for military units to survive and fight in jungle terrain. It has been the topic of extensive study by military strategists, and was an important part of the planning for both sides in many conflicts, including World War II and the Vietnam War. The jungle has a variety of effects on military operations.

Desert warfare is combat in deserts. One of the main requirements in desert warfare is an adequate supply of water. Some of the most robust armies have perished as a result of dehydration, Water is also a concern in modern desert armies, and for that reason, its use is often prioritised on the essentials.

Arctic warfare or winter warfare is any armed conflict that takes place in an exceptionally cold climate, usually in snowy and icy terrain, sometimes on ice-covered bodies of water. Arctic warfare is very dependent on equipment. For survival, troops need warm clothing and footwear, extra nutritious food, white camouflage, tents with sleeping bags, heaters and fuel.

Since the 20th century an amphibious landing of troops on a beachhead is acknowledged as the most complex of all military manoeuvres. The undertaking requires an intricate coordination of numerous military specialities, including air power, naval gunfire, naval transport, logistical planning, specialised equipment, land warfare, tactics, and extensive training in the nuances of this manoeuvre for all personnel involved.

Training our infantry units in warfare is vital if we want to have the upper hand in combat. Just giving our units the best weapons and techs isn't enough, they also have to be familiar with various tactics and survival strategies.

Guerrilla warfare is a form of irregular warfare in which a small group of combatants such as armed civilians or irregulars use military tactics including ambushes, sabotage, raids, petty warfare, hit-and-run tactics, and mobility to fight a larger and less-mobile traditional military.
We must insure that even our most basic infantry knows how to fight and survive on the battlefield, providing them with the proper training will insure they survive longer.

Advanced infantry training will allows us to further improve the morale of our troops and their understanding of the battlefield, with troops trained by our best generals we can insure they can win almost any battle.

Only the best of the best will take advantage of these training programs, with elite troops on the battlefield we can ensure that the outcome of the battle will be in our favor. These troops are not only better equipped but are also training in tactics other troops may not be familiar with.
Our Airborne-Capable infantry need to employ superior tactics and training in order to ensure victory on the battlefield by using this sophisticated insertion method.

A main battle tank (MBT), also known as a battle tank or universal tank, is a tank that fills the heavy direct fire role of many modern armies. They were originally conceived to replace the light, medium, heavy and super-heavy tanks. Development was spurred in the Cold War with the development of lightweight composite armor. They are still supplemented in some armies with light tanks.

A tank destroyer or tank hunter is a type of armored fighting vehicle armed with a gun or missile launcher, and is designed specifically to engage enemy armored vehicles. Tanks are generally armoured fighting vehicles designed for front-line combat while the tank destroyer is specifically designed mainly for taking on enemy armour.

Mechs are most efficient where our conventional tanks cannot operate in terrain such as mountains and hills. These units are still experimental on the battlefield and their effectiveness is a debated issue along the military ranks.

Heavy mechs are giant walking guns that can provide the firepower where our main battle tanks cannot reach. While vulnerable to attack from the front or by fast moving infantry units these units can break most defense and especially those in the mountains where our tanks are not effective.

A technical is a type of improvised fighting vehicle, typically a civilian or military non-combat vehicle, modified to provide an offensive capability similar to a military gun truck. It is usually an open-backed civilian pickup truck or four-wheel drive vehicle mounting a machine gun, light anti-aircraft gun, anti-tank weapon, or other support weapon.

A military armored (or armoured) car is a wheeled light armored vehicle, lighter than other armored fighting vehicles, primarily being armored and/or armed for self-defense of the occupants. Other multi-axled wheeled military vehicles can be quite large, and actually be superior to some smaller tracked vehicles in terms of armor and armament.
As a smaller forward-deployed unit, armored cars and MRAP's can be used for Reconnaissance/Support missions. This unit will give extra support to your army formations.

A light tank is a tank variant initially designed for rapid movement, and now primarily employed in the reconnaissance role, or in support of expeditionary forces where main battle tanks cannot be made available. Early light tanks were generally armed and armored similar to an armored car, but used tracks in order to provide better cross-country mobility.

Vehicle armour is sometimes improvised in the midst of an armed conflict by vehicle crews or individual units. During the 2011 Libyan civil war, anti-Gaddafi forces were seen operating T-55 tanks and Technicals with improvised armour mounted on them, likely in an attempt to improve survivability against superior Libyan Army hardware such as T-72 tanks.

Armour with two or more plates spaced a distance apart, called spaced armour, has been in use since the First World War, where it was used on the Schneider CA1 and St Chamond tanks. Spaced armour can be advantageous in several situations. For example, it can reduce the effectiveness of kinetic energy penetrators because the interaction with each plate can cause the round to tumble, deflect, deform, or disintegrate.

Explosive reactive armour, initially developed by German researcher Manfred Held while working in Israel, uses layers of high explosive sandwiched between steel plates. When a shaped-charge warhead hits, the explosive detonates and pushes the steel plates into the warhead, disrupting the flow of the charge's liquid metal penetrator.

Electrically charged armour is a recent development in the United Kingdom by the Defence Science and Technology Laboratory. A vehicle is fitted with two thin shells, separated by insulating material. The outer shell holds an enormous electrical charge, while the inner shell is at ground. If an incoming HEAT jet penetrates the outer shell and forms a bridge between the shells, the electrical energy discharges through the jet, disrupting it.

The internal combustion engine (ICE) is an engine where the combustion of a fuel (typically petroleum derived such as gasoline or diesel fuel) occurs with an oxidizer (usually air) in a combustion chamber that is an integral part of the working fluid flow circuit. In an internal combustion engine the expansion of the high-temperature and high-pressure gases produced by combustion apply direct force to some component of the engine.

An external combustion engine (EC engine) is a heat engine where an (internal) working fluid is heated by combustion in an external source, through the engine wall or a heat exchanger. The fluid then, by expanding and acting on the mechanism of the engine, produces motion and usable work.

Armour-piercing discarding sabot (APDS) is a type of kinetic energy projectile fired from a gun to attack armoured targets. APDS rounds are sabot rounds and were commonly used in large calibre tank guns, but have now been superseded by armour-piercing fin-stabilized discarding sabot (APFSDS) projectiles in such guns. However, APDS rounds are still commonly used in small or medium calibre weapon systems.

Many newer medium calibre APDS cores use a frangible high density alloy, the resulting projectiles are called Frangible Armour Piercing Discarding Sabot (FAPDS) for APDS types, or FRAP (Frangible Armour Piercing) for full calibre projectiles. During penetration, a frangible projectile’s core fragments into many high velocity pieces.

With innovations in our laser technology we can finally use laser mounted turrets which are much more accurate than regular projectile weapons and can allow a variety of functions to our vehicles and tanks. From literally cooking the enemy infantry to disabling mechanical equipment on enemy vehicles and installations.

A railgun is an electrically powered artillery gun that accelerates a conductive projectile along electromagnetic rails, using the same principles as the homopolar motor. Railguns use two sliding or rolling contacts that permit a large electric current to pass through the projectile. This current interacts with the strong magnetic fields generated by the rails and this accelerates the projectile.
By upgrading our vehicles with machine guns we can improve their defence capabilities and also their anti infantry offensive capabilities.

An anti-tank missile (ATM), anti-tank guided missile (ATGM), anti-tank guided weapon (ATGW) or anti-armor guided weapon, is a guided missile primarily designed to hit and destroy heavily armored military vehicles.

A grenade luncher gives our vehicles many advantages, from smoke grenades used for concealment to frag grenades that are used to clear infantry from buildings. Equipping our vehicles and tanks with these upgrades will make them much more deadly on the battlefield.

An autoloader, as its name suggests, extracts a shell and propellant charge from the ammunition storage rack/compartment and loads it into a magazine, if the gun has one, or directly into the chamber of the gun if it does not. It can and often does replace a human loader. By automating the loading process, it can streamline and speed up the loading process, resulting in a more effective fighting machine.

Mountain warfare is one of the most dangerous types of combat as it involves surviving not only combat with the enemy but also the extreme weather and dangerous terrain.

The jungle has a variety of effects on military operations.

Some of the most robust armies have perished as a result of dehydration, Water is also a concern in modern desert armies, and for that reason, its use is often prioritised on the essentials.

Arctic warfare is very dependent on equipment. For survival, troops need warm clothing and footwear, extra nutritious food, white camouflage, tents with sleeping bags, heaters and fuel.

Rocket artillery is a type of artillery equipped with rocket launchers instead of conventional guns or mortars. Modern rocket artillery such as the US M270 Multiple Launch Rocket System is highly mobile and are used in similar fashion to other self-propelled artillery. Global Positioning and Inertial Navigation terminal guidance systems have been introduced.
With the introduction of guided missiles to our rocket artillery we can have a much higher precision when hitting our targets from afar.
Providing our infantry with mortar launchers will allow them to strike back at enemy artillery attacks and increase suppression on enemy infantry units.

A howitzer is a type of artillery piece characterized by a relatively short barrel and the use of comparatively small propellant charges to propel projectiles at relatively high trajectories, with a steep angle of descent. Until fairly recently (about the end of the Second World War) such weapons were characterized by a barrel length 15 to 25 times their caliber.

Modern self-propelled artillery vehicles may superficially resemble tanks, but they are generally lightly armoured, too lightly to survive in direct-fire combat. However, they protect their crews against shrapnel and small arms and are therefore usually included as armoured fighting vehicles. Many are equipped with machine guns for defense against enemy infantry.
By placing our most powerful guns in low orbit we can strike anywhere at any time and our guns are much better defended than their tactical ground level counterparts.
Our mobile artillery pieces and A-A launchers need reliable engines if we want the to perform to their best extent in combat.

As artillery units are vulnerable to air strikes and A-A units are vulnerable to artillery bombardment, it would be wise to invest time and capital for researching better chassis to improve their protection.

A Passive Electronically Scanned Array (PESA), also known as passive phased array is a phased array radar which has a single central radio frequency source. This type of RADAR is more suitable for short range, close in air defence systems.

Active Electronically Scanned Array (AESA) devices, which have a separate radio frequency source for each phase shifter/emitting element. This type of RADAR is more advanced than PESA and more suitable to track more qualified targets such as high-end military aircraft and should therefore be used in long range air defence systems.
A fire-control system is a number of components working together, usually a gun data computer, a director, which is designed to assist a weapon system

Target acquisition is the detection, identification, and location of a target in sufficient detail to permit the effective employment of lethal and non-lethal means. The term is used for a broad area of applications. This type of system should be deployed along side artillery batteries to help organize the artillery fire missions.

High explosives are explosive materials that detonate, meaning that the explosive shock front passes through the material at a supersonic speed. This type of ammunition is the most common and cheaper variant that artillery systems use.

Area denial artillery munition, or just simply artillery-laid AT mines is a type of ammunition that is deployed to halt an probable advance of enemy forces. It is especially effective against armoured transports and lighter armoured vehicles

Short-Range air defence systems can utilize both more traditional yet updated cannons and short range surface-air-missiles. An excellent example is the Russian 9K22 Tunguska which uses both missiles and a twin-cannon.

column2: The accuracy and tactics employed by our artillery brigades can only take them so far. We can take our existing models and develop larger calibers of artillery and more powerful ammo. This will enable our artillery brigades to increase the firepower they can bring to bear against enemy targets.
column3: La précision et la tactique employées par nos brigades d'artillerie peuvent ne peuvent les aider que pour le moment. Nous pouvons nous inspirer des modèles existants et développer de plus gros calibres d'artillerie et des munitions plus puissantes. Ceci permettra à nos brigades d'artillerie d'augmenter la puissance de feu qu'ils peuvent opposer aux cibles ennemies.
column4: Bei allen Bemühungen hat auch die Genauigkeit und Taktik unserer Artillerie-Brigaden hat ihre Grenzen. Wir können basierend auf den bestehenden Geschützmodellen größerkalibrige Artillerie und stärkere Munition entwickeln. Dies wird sich positiv auf die Feuerkraft unserer Artillerie-Brigaden auswirken.
column6: La precisión y las tácticas empleadas por nuestras brigadas de artillería no pueden darles más de sí. Podemos tomar nuestro actual modelo y desarrollar calibres de artillería más grandes y munición más potente. Esto permitirá a nuestras brigadas de artillería aumentar la potencia de fuego que despliegan contra los objetivos enemigos.

column2: To be able to use our artillery to its full potential, their shells have to be accurate in all circumstances. If we research new technologies for sights and targeting then our artillery brigades will be more effective. This is especially useful in helping to suppress enemy attacks, lowering our casualties. It should also enable us to do more damage to enemy mobile and armored units.
column3: Pour pouvoir utiliser pleinement le potentiel de notre artillerie, leurs tirs d'obus doivent être précis en toute circonstance. Si nous recherchons de nouvelles techniques de visée et de balistique, nos brigades d'artillerie seront plus efficaces. Ceci est particulièrement utile et aide à repousser les attaques ennemies. De plus, ceci devrait également nous permettre d'infliger plus de dégâts aux unités mobiles et aux unités blindées de l'ennemi.
column4: Damit unsere Artillerie ihr Potential voll ausschöpfen kann, muss ihr Beschuss exakt sein. Die Effizienz unserer Artillerie-Brigaden könnte durch die Erforschung neuer Zielvorrichtungen gesteigert werden. Dies wäre besonders für die Unterdrückung feindlicher Angriffe hilfreich, womit unsere Verluste reduziert werden könnten. Darüber hinaus könnte unsere Artillerie mobilen Einheiten größeren Schaden zufügen.
column6: Para disponer de la artillería en su potencial máximo, sus proyectiles tienen que ser precisos en todas las circunstancias. Si investigamos nuevas tecnologías para nuestras miras y sistemas de guía, nuestras brigadas de artillería podrán resultar más eficaces.  Esto es especialmente útil a la hora de apoyar la supresión de ataques enemigos y reduciendo las bajas. Asimismo, debería permitirnos infligir más daño a las unidades móviles y acorazadas.

column2: Even the best anti-tank weapons are useless if they can not hit their targets. By investing in new anti-tank weapons and targeting devices, our anti-tank weapons will be better able to hit and damage enemy targets. This should cause the enemy to be more cautious in their attacks and our units will take fewer losses.
column3: Même les meilleures armes anti-chars sont inutiles lorsqu'elles ne peuvent pas atteindre leur cibles. En investissant dans de nouvelles armes anti-chars et dans la balistique, nos armes anti-chars seront davantage en mesure d'atteindre et d'endommager des cibles ennemies. Ceci devrait amener l'ennemi à être plus prudent lors de ses attaques et nos unités subiront moins de pertes.
column4: Wenn sie ihre Ziele nicht treffen können, sind selbst die besten Panzerabwehrkanonen nutzlos. Durch die Investition in neue Paks und entsprechende Zielvorrichtungen werden unsere Panzerabwehrwaffen feindliche Ziele mit größerer Wahrscheinlichkeit treffen. Dies sollte den Feind bei seinen Angriffen vorsichtiger handeln lassen und die Verluste unserer Einheiten reduzieren.
column6: Incluso las mejores armas anticarro son inútiles si no alcanzan el objetivo. Si invertimos en nuevo armamento anticarro y sistemas de guía, nuestras armas anticarro tendrán más probabilidades de alcanzar y dañar objetivos enemigos. Esto debería hacer que el enemigo se muestre más cauto en sus ataques, y nuestras unidades sufrirán menos bajas.

column2: Against thicker and more advanced armor, the penetration ability of anti-tank weapons is paramount. By focusing our efforts on improved ammo, we should be able to improve our anti-tank brigades. The new ammo will allow them do more damage to enemy hard and armored units.
column3: La pénétration des armes anti-chars joue un rôle prépondérant contre les blindages plus épais et plus évolués. En concentrant nos efforts sur l'amélioration des munitions, nous devrions être en mesure de faire évoluer nos brigades anti-chars. Les nouvelles munitions leur permettront d'infliger plus de dégâts aux unités "mécanisées" et blindées.
column4: Gegen dickere und modernere Panzerungen ist die Durchschlagskraft von Paks ausschlaggebend. Durch die Fokussierung unserer Forschungsbemühungen auf verbesserte Munition sollten wir unsere Panzerabwehr-Brigaden aufwerten können. Mit der neuen Munition können sie gepanzerten Einheiten des Feinds mehr Schaden zufügen.
column6: La capacidad de penetración de las armas anticarro es esencial contra blindajes más densos y avanzados. Si centramos nuestros esfuerzos en mejorar la munición, podríamos mejorar de paso nuestras brigadas anticarro. La nueva munición le permitirá infligir más daño a las unidades "resistentes" y blindadas.

column2: Our ground forces can take heavy losses if attacked from the air. By developing new anti-air weapons and ammo, our specialized AA brigades will cause more damage to attacking enemy planes. This should also help to prevent the planes from damaging the rest of the division.
column3: Nos forces au sol peuvent subir de lourdes pertes si elles sont soumises à des attaques aériennes. En développant de nouvelles armes et munitions antiaériennes, nos brigades AA spécialisées infligeront plus de dégâts aux avions ennemis les attaquant. Ceci devrait également nous permettre d'empêcher les avions d'endommager le reste de la division.
column4: Unsere Bodentruppen erleiden bei Luftangriffen schwere Verluste. Durch die Entwicklung neuer Flugabwehrwaffen und entsprechender Munition können unsere Flak-Brigaden feindlichen Flugzeugen mehr Schaden zufügen. Dies sollte feindlicher Flieger auch davon abhalten, den Rest der Division zu beschädigen.
column6: Nuestras fuerzas terrestres pueden sufrir muchas bajas si son atacadas desde el aire. Si desarrollamos armas y munición antiaérea, nuestras brigadas especializadas antiaéreas causarán más daño a los aviones enemigos. Esto debería reducir los daños de los aviones al resto de la división.

column2: When not engaging enemy planes, our anti-air units can be put to use against ground forces. By improving their sights and targeting equipment, our anti-air brigades will be able to function as light anti-tank weapons. This will means their divisions will take fewer casualties and cause more damage to enemy units.
column3: Lorsqu'elles ne sont pas engagées dans un combat contre des avions ennemis, nos unités antiaériennes peuvent être utilisées contre des forces au sol. En améliorant les viseurs et la balistique, nos brigades antiaériennes pourront se comporter comme munies d'armes légères anti-chars. Cela signifie que leurs divisions subiront moins de pertes et qu'elles infligeront plus de dégâts aux unités ennemies.
column4: Wenn sie keine feindlichen Flugzeuge beschießen, können unsere Flak-Einheiten auch gegen Bodenziele zum Einsatz gebracht werden. Durch die Verbesserung ihrer Zielvorrichtungen können unsere Flaks auch als leichte Paks fungieren. Dadurch erleiden ihre Divisionen geringere Verluste und können dem Feind mehr schaden.
column6: Cuando no se estén encargando de la aviación enemiga, nuestras unidades antiaéreas pueden luchar contra fuerzas terrestres. Si mejoramos sus miras y sistema de guía, nuestras brigadas antiaéreas podrán actuar como armas anticarro ligeras.  Esto quiere decir que sus divisiones sufrirán menos bajas e infligirán más daño a las unidades enemigas.

column2: Standard artillery can be costly to build and has a limited rate of fire. By combining our military knowledge of artillery and rockets, we will be able to build new rocket artillery brigades. Rocket artillery will be cheaper to build and will be able to deliver more firepower quickly in battle. This is especially useful for offensive campaigns. The brigades themselves are cheaper to build. However, their ammunition is more expensive to supply.
column3: Constituer une artillerie standard peut être coûteux et sa cadence de tir est limitée. En alliant nos connaissances militaires de l'artillerie et des roquettes, nous pourrons créer de nouvelles brigades d'artillerie lance-roquettes. Créer une artillerie lance-roquettes sera moins coûteux: lors des combats, elle apportera une puissance de feu accrue et une cadence de tir plus rapide. Constituer les brigades en elles-mêmes est moins coûteux. Cependant, approvisionner ces brigades en munitions est plus onéreux.
column4: Herkömmliche Artillerie ist teuer in der Herstellung und hat eine limitierte Schussfrequenz. Durch die Kombinierung unseres militärischen Wissens um Artillerie und Raketen können wir neue Raketenartillerie-Brigaden aufstellen. Raketenartillerie ist schneller und billiger zu bauen und bietet darüber hinaus auch noch mehr Feuerkraft, besonders für Offensiven sehr nützlich. Der Bau von Raketenartillerie ist billig, die erforderliche Munition jedoch keineswegs.
column6: La artillería estándar puede ser cara de construir y tiene una cadencia de fuego limitada. Si combinamos nuestros conocimientos militares en materia de artillería y cohetes, podremos construir nuevas brigadas de artillería de cohetes. Será más barata de construir y podrá desplegar rápidamente más potencia de fuego, siendo útil en campañas ofensivas. Las propias brigadas son más baratas de construir. No obstante, su munición es más cara.

column2: One key capability of rocket artillery's is to deliver large amounts of explosives simultaneously. If we introduce new launchers and more powerful rockets then this bonus will be multiplied. This will mean our rocket artillery brigades will do more damage against enemy units.

column2: An attack aircraft (also called a strike aircraft or attack bomber) is a tactical military aircraft that has a primary role of attacking targets on the ground or sea, with greater precision than bombers, and which is prepared to encounter stronger low-level air defenses. This class of aircraft is designed mostly for close air support and naval air-to-surface missions.

An attack helicopter is a military helicopter with the primary role of an attack aircraft, with the capability of engaging targets on the ground, such as enemy infantry and armored vehicles. Due to their heavy armament they are sometimes called helicopter gunships. Weapons used on attack helicopters can include autocannons, machine-guns, rockets, and guided missiles such as the Hellfire.

In military tactics, close air support (CAS) is defined as air action by fixed or rotary-winged aircraft against hostile targets that are close to friendly ground or naval forces, and which requires detailed integration of each air mission with fire and movement of these forces. Close air support requires excellent coordination with ground forces.
Maritime aircraft are specifically equipped to attack naval targets such as warships and submarines. These bombers carry special ammunition which is more effective against underwater and naval units.

A strategic bomber is a mid-to-long range heavy bomber designed to drop large amounts of ordnance onto a distant target for the purposes of debilitating the enemy's capacity to wage war. Unlike tactical bombers and ground attack aircraft, which are used in air interdiction operations to attack enemy combatants and military equipment, strategic bombers are built to fly into enemy territory to destroy strategic targets.

UAV bombers will allow us to attack remote areas where there is a high risk for our pilots. While these aircraft do not require a pilot they do require a remote operator who is stationed far away from the battlefield as well as advanced equipment that allows them to operate on their own which makes them much more expensive than conventional bomber aircraft.

Military transport helicopters are used in places where the use of conventional aircraft is impossible. For example the military transport helicopter is the primary transport asset of US Marines deploying from LHDs and LHA. The landing possibilities of helicopters are almost unlimited, and where landing is impossible, for example densely packed jungle, the ability of the helicopter to hover allows troops to deploy by abseiling and roping.

Military transport aircraft or military cargo aircraft are typically fixed and rotary wing cargo aircraft which are used to deliver troops, weapons and other military equipment by a variety of methods to any area of military operations around the surface of the planet, usually outside of the commercial flight routes in uncontrolled airspace.

A jet engine is a reaction engine that discharges a fast moving jet which generates thrust by jet propulsion in accordance with Newton's laws of motion. This broad definition of jet engines includes turbojets, turbofans, rockets, ramjets, pulse jets. In general, most jet engines are internal combustion engines but non-combusting forms also exist. These types of jet engines are primarily used by jet aircraft for long distance travel.

An airbreathing jet engine is a jet engine propelled by a jet of hot exhaust gases formed from air that is drawn into the engine via an inlet duct. All practical airbreathing jet engines are internal combustion engines that directly heat the air by burning fuel, with the resultant hot gases used for propulsion via a propulsive nozzle, although other techniques for heating the air have been experimented with.

A precooled jet engine is a concept for high speed jet engines that features a cryogenic fuel-cooled heat exchanger immediately after the air intake, to precool the air entering the engine. After gaining heat and vapourising in the heat exchanger system, the fuel (e.g. H2) is burnt in the combustor. Precooled jet engines were described by Robert P. Carmichael in 1955.

An electric jet engine uses both fuel and electricity to power the bomber. This technique allows to save up much more fuel as well as use an experimental solar panels that use solar power to power up the bomber in addition to the other two methods.

Chaff is a radar countermeasure in which aircraft or other targets spread a cloud of small, thin pieces of aluminium, metallized glass fibre or plastic, which either appears as a cluster of primary targets on radar screens or swamps the screen with multiple returns.

A (decoy) flare is an aerial infrared countermeasure to counter an infrared homing (heat seeking) surface-to-air missile or air-to-air missile. Flares are commonly composed of a pyrotechnic composition based on magnesium or another hot-burning metal, with burning temperature equal to or hotter than engine exhaust. The aim is to make the infrared-guided missile seek out the heat signature from the flare rather than the aircraft's engines.

An electronic countermeasure (ECM) is an electrical or electronic device designed to trick or deceive radar, sonar or other detection systems, like infrared (IR) or lasers. It may be used both offensively and defensively to deny targeting information to an enemy. The system may make many separate targets appear to the enemy, or make the real target appear to disappear or move about randomly.

column3: however, larger, more sophisticated aircraft (such as airliners or military combat aircraft) have AC systems operating at 400 Hz, 115 volts AC. Upgrading our avionics technology will allow us to build new generation fighters.

Unguided munition, or free fall bombs is the type that is traditionally used in strategic bombing missions, but also different close air support (CAS) missions. These are less advanced and less effective than precision guided munition..
Precision guided munition is a more advanced variant of air to ground weaponry. It included both guided bombs or "Smart Bombs" and tactical air to ground missiles such as the AGM-65 Maverick.
Maritime Aircraft and Carrier Air Wings (CAWs) have to utilize torpedoes or anti-ship missiles to eliminate surface ships or submarines.
In order to destroy armoured targets, our CAS and Strike Aircraft need to be armed with more powerful machine guns of a higher calibre.

Training our bomber pilots is essential if we want them to be successful in their missions, more advanced forms of training will be available once we get some veterans in our air force to teach the lessons of the past to newcomers.

Bombers and fighters fly differently and use different weapons and systems. It is vital for our pilots to understand these differences and use the advantages our new techs give them as well as learn the basics that have served military pilots in the past.

Our best bomber pilots can pass on the experience to our new pilots to improve their knowledge when using bombers in their missions. These lessons are vital to improve the knowledge and effectiveness of our pilots.
Ground attack tactics provide our pilots with the know-how on conducting the various missions they might be sent on, each of these missions has its own elements and considerations.

When sending our pilots behind enemy lines to attack logistical installation and support units we need to prepare them for what they might encounter, improving their knowledge will improve the effectiveness of these missions.

Taking out the enemy fighters and bombers before they they attack can change the outcome of any campaign, if we manage to kill the enemy pilots too we can cripple their ability to use their planes in the future.
When the enemy fleet is stationed in port it is simply a sitting duck waiting for us to take out. If we can destroy or disable the enemy naval power it can greatly help our war effort.
Attacking moving ships and subs is not as simple as it may sound, there are many things to take into consideration and our pilots must ready and prepared to carry out these kind of missions.

By organizing our strategic air combat units under a strong joint command, we can perform combat missions more efficiently with minimal aircraft losses and minimal strain on our pilots and ground crew.

Suppression of Enemy Air Defenses (SEAD), also known as "Wild Weasel" operations in the United States, are military actions to suppress enemy surface-based air defenses, including not only surface-to-air missiles (SAMs) and anti-aircraft artillery (AAA) but also interrelated systems such as early-warning radar and command.This suppression can be accomplished both by physically destroying the systems or by disrupting and deceiving them through electronic warfare.

Transport aircraft can not only drop airborne troops behind enemy lines, they can also drop supplies to units that are short of them. This is a extra efficient way to make sure that troops in harsh terrain receive their required logistics.

Fourth-generation jet fighter is a general classification of fighter aircraft in service from approximately 1980 to present day, and represent design concepts of the 1970s. Fourth-generation designs are heavily influenced by lessons learned from the previous generation of combat aircraft.

An interceptor aircraft, or simply interceptor, is a type of fighter aircraft designed specifically to prevent successful missions by enemy aircraft, particularly bombers and reconnaissance aircraft. Since this type of aircraft is intended for long range engagements, they are only armed with missiles and should not enter dogfights against enemies.

Air superiority fighters are designed to effectively engage enemy fighters, more than other types of aircraft. They are usually more expensive and procured in smaller numbers than multi role fighters.

The primary role air-to-air combat and the secondary role is  air-to-surface combat that could include aerial reconnaissance and close air support. Since multi-role aircraft use a combined payload, they have traded down their air to air capabilities.

Our interceptor aircraft need to have solid tactics in preparation for when unknown aircraft enter our air space or sphere of interest. Our air combat academies can educate the pilots further to make them more capable during missions.

In the later 20th century, the obsolescence of the battleship left the cruiser as the largest and most powerful surface combatant. The role of the cruiser varied according to ship and navy, often including air defense, commerce raiding and shore bombardment.

A nuclear guided missile cruiser is a nuclear-powered cruiser that can remain active at sea for much longer periods without refuelling regularly. While being much more expensive to construct their maintenance is drastically reduced and their ability to go on long missions at sea gives them an edge over the regular guided missile cruiser.

A carrier air wing is an operational naval aviation organization composed of several aircraft squadrons and detachments of various types of fixed wing and rotary wing aircraft. Organized, equipped and trained to conduct modern navy carrier air operations while embarked aboard aircraft carriers.

An aircraft carrier is a warship with a full-length flight deck and facilities for carrying, arming, deploying, and recovering aircraft, that serves as a seagoing airbase. Typically, it is the capital ship of a fleet, as it allows a naval force to project air power worldwide without depending on local bases for staging aircraft operations.

A nuclear powered aircraft carrier gives us every advantage of a conventional carrier without the constant need to refuel these giant ships. This allows them to remain at sea for much longer periods of time and perform their task of power projection in addition to various military missions and objectives.
Once we have a design and layout we need to research hull construction. This will require materials capable of supporting and protecting our structures throughout their operational lifetime.
Further improving our hull design will help our ships sustain more damage in battle as well as being faster and thus harder to detect by the enemy.

The design of new materials and techniques to minimise the optical and infrared signature, above water acoustic and hydroacoustic signature, underwater electrical potential and magnetic signature, pressure signature, radar cross section and actively emitted signals.

Similiar in concept to the jet engine, gas turbines are used in many naval vessels not for direct thrust, but for generating electricity and shaft horsepower. They are valued for their high power-to-weight ratio and their ships' resulting acceleration and ability to get underway quickly.
Improving our propulsion systems even further will allow our ships to travel faster and consume even less fuel this reducing their need to dock and fuel before a long mission.

Using a nuclear reactor to power a ship was revolutionary for naval warfare when first proposed.  It requires no oxygen for combustion and emits no exhaust gas allowing the vessel to be designed without intake and exhaust stacks.  To improve operational ability we must research quieter and more efficient designs.

Capital ships need to carefully shift their displacement around as they put water in their waste tanks and drain fuel from others.  If we improve our displacement control systems our ships will be more stable while operating at high speeds.
Our capital warships need systems to prevent them from sinking when they take damage. By improving their damage control systems our crews may better handle flooding emergencies.

Our aircraft carriers store aircraft below the flight deck in what is called the hangar.  Be researching improved elevator, storage, and maintenance systems we can increase the amount of aircraft our Carriers can hold and support.
Anti-aircraft missiles are surface-to-air missiles designed to be launched from a ship to destroy aircraft or other missiles. They are a necessity for all front-line surface warships.

Anti-ship missiles are guided missiles that are designed for use against ships and large boats. Most anti-ship missiles are of the sea-skimming type, many use a combination of inertial guidance and radar homing. A good number of other anti-ship missiles use infrared homing to follow the heat that is emitted by a ship; it is also possible for anti-ship missiles to be guided by radio command all the way.

The modern torpedo is a self-propelled weapon with an explosive warhead, launched above or below the water surface, propelled underwater towards a target, and designed to detonate either on contact with its target or in proximity to it. Today's torpedoes can be divided into lightweight and heavyweight classes; and into straight-running, autonomous homers, and wire-guided.

A cruise missile is a guided missile, usually propelled by a jet engine due to their greater efficiency at low altitude and sub-sonic speed, that carries an explosive payload towards a land-based or sea-based target. They are designed to deliver a large warhead over long distances with high accuracy. Modern cruise missiles can travel at supersonic or high subsonic speeds, are self-navigating, and can fly on a non-ballistic, extremely low altitude trajectory.

Modern capital warships carry a mixture of light, medium, and large guns for use against other surface ships. Researching improved weapons will mean we can build new models which are more effective against surface targets.

A railgun is an electrically powered artillery gun that accelerates a conductive projectile along electromagnetic rails, using the same principles as the homopolar motor. Railguns use two sliding or rolling contacts that permit a large electric current to pass through the projectile. This current interacts with the strong magnetic fields generated by the rails and this accelerates the projectile.

Finding enemy fleets or aeroplanes at sea is always difficult. RADAR offers our capital warships the chance to detect the enemy at long ranges and engage or avoid them as we see fit. Researching new RADAR technology will mean we can upgrade our small warships, and give them a greater chance to spot ships and aircraft.

Submarines are blind when deep underwater and invisible to ships on the surface. SONAR allows our capital warships to be able to detect enemy ships and submarines by sound without revealing their presence. If we research improved SONAR we will be able to upgrade our capital ships so they can spot the enemy more easily.
Countermeasures are devices and decoys the objective of which is to deny or delay acquisition of targets by missiles until they are no longer capable of impacting their designated termination point.

A close-in weapon system is a naval shipboard point-defense weapon for detecting and destroying at short range incoming anti-ship missiles and enemy aircraft which have penetrated the outer defenses. Nearly all classes of modern warship are equipped with some kind of CIWS device.

A submarine is a watercraft capable of independent operation underwater. It differs from a submersible, which has more limited underwater capability. Most large submarines consist of a cylindrical body with hemispherical (and/or conical) ends and a vertical structure, usually located amidships, which houses communications and sensing devices as well as periscopes.

A ballistic missile submarine is a submarine equipped to launch submarine-launched ballistic missiles (SLBMs) with nuclear warheads. These submarines became a major weapon system in the Cold War because of their nuclear deterrence capability.

In the 1950s, nuclear power partially replaced diesel-electric propulsion. Equipment was also developed to extract oxygen from sea water. These two innovations gave submarines the ability to remain submerged for weeks or months.

From the 1950s to the 1970s, the United States Navy commissioned ships classed as guided missile frigates which were actually anti-aircraft warfare cruisers built on destroyer-style hulls. Some of these ships—the Bainbridge, Truxtun, California and Virginia classes—were nuclear-powered. These "frigates" were roughly mid-way in size between cruisers and destroyers.

A guided missile destroyer is a destroyer designed to launch guided missiles. Many are also equipped to carry out anti-submarine, anti-air, and anti-surface operations. In addition to the guns that destroyers have, a guided missile destroyer is usually equipped with two large missile magazines which store the missiles for the ship, usually in Vertical Launch Cells.

A corvette is a small, maneuverable, lightly armed warship, originally smaller than a frigate and larger than a coastal patrol craft or fast attack craft. Although almost all modern navies use ships smaller than frigates for coastal duty, not all of them use the term corvette.

Landing craft are boats and seagoing vessels used to convey a landing force (infantry and vehicles) from the sea to the shore during an amphibious assault. Most renowned are those used to storm the beaches of Normandy, the Mediterranean, and many Pacific islands during World War II. This was the high point of the landing craft, with a significant number of different designs produced in large quantities by the United Kingdom and United States.

Similiar in concept to the jet engine, gas turbines are used in many naval vessels not for direct thrust, but for generating electricity and shaft horsepower. They are valued for their high power-to-weight ratio and their ships' resulting acceleration and ability to get underway quickly.

Diesel engines are internal combustion engines that can be started and stopped quickly but require air and a high compression ratio to run.  We must research lighter, quieter, and more powerful diesel engines to improve the operational ability of our conventional submarines.

Using a nuclear reactor to power a ship was revolutionary for naval warfare when first proposed.  The most important advantage it provides for a submarine is that it requires no oxygen for combustion and emits no exhaust gas allowing the vessel to operate submerged for a period limited only by crew endurance and supplies.  To improve operational ability we must research quieter and more efficient designs.

The Combat Information Center is the tactical center of a warship providing processed information for command and control of the near battle space or 'area of operations'.  Command and control brings together and manages information on the warship's status, its surroundings and supplies this to the commanding officer, who would generally be present on the nearby bridge or present where plots can be viewed.

A close-in weapon system is a naval shipboard point-defense weapon for detecting and destroying at short range incoming anti-ship missiles and enemy aircraft which have penetrated the outer defenses. Nearly all classes of modern warship are equipped with some kind of CIWS device.

A fire-control system is a number of components, often interfaced with sensors, working together which is designed to assist a weapon system in hitting its target. As is the case with missile systems, once the firing solution is calculated many modern fire-control systems are also able to aim and fire the weapons.
Anti-aircraft missiles are surface-to-air missiles designed to be launched from a ship to destroy aircraft or other missiles. They are a necessity for all front-line surface warships.

Anti-ship missiles are guided missiles that are designed for use against ships and large boats. Most anti-ship missiles are of the sea-skimming type, many use a combination of inertial guidance and radar homing. A good number of other anti-ship missiles use infrared homing to follow the heat that is emitted by a ship; it is also possible for anti-ship missiles to be guided by radio command all the way.

The modern torpedo is a self-propelled weapon with an explosive warhead, launched above or below the water surface, propelled underwater towards a target, and designed to detonate either on contact with its target or in proximity to it. Today's torpedoes can be divided into lightweight and heavyweight classes; and into straight-running, autonomous homers, and wire-guided.

A cruise missile is a guided missile, usually propelled by a jet engine due to their greater efficiency at low altitude and sub-sonic speed, that carries an explosive payload towards a land-based or sea-based target. They are designed to deliver a large warhead over long distances with high accuracy. Modern cruise missiles can travel at supersonic or high subsonic speeds, are self-navigating, and can fly on a non-ballistic, extremely low altitude trajectory.
Small warships carry a mixture of light guns for use against other surface ships. Researching improved weapons will mean we can build new models which are more effective against surface targets.

A railgun is an electrically powered artillery gun that accelerates a conductive projectile along electromagnetic rails, using the same principles as the homopolar motor. Railguns use two sliding or rolling contacts that permit a large electric current to pass through the projectile. This current interacts with the strong magnetic fields generated by the rails and this accelerates the projectile.

Finding enemy fleets or aeroplanes at sea is always difficult. RADAR offers our small warships the chance to detect the enemy at long ranges and engage or avoid them as we see fit. Researching new RADAR technology will mean we can upgrade our small warships, and give them a greater chance to spot ships and aircraft.

Submarines are blind when deep underwater and invisible to ships on the surface. SONAR allows our small warships to be able to detect enemy ships and submarines by sound without revealing their presence. If we research improved SONAR we will be able to upgrade our small ships and submarines so they can spot the enemy more easily.
Countermeasures are devices and decoys the objective of which is to deny or delay acquisition of targets by missiles until they are no longer capable of impacting their designated termination point.

column6: Atacar a los buques enemigos en alta mar es una de las misiones clave de nuestra aviación naval. Por ello, el desarrollo de las tácticas adecuadas para asegurar la consecución de la misión con eficacia es de la mayor importancia.

column3: La formation de pilote est primordiale si nous souhaitons exploiter au mieux les conceptions de nos avions. Même de simples choses comme entraîner nos pilotes à tirer au meilleur moment pour économiser les munitions leur permettront d'exploiter au mieux nos avions. Ceci permettra à nos chasseurs de combattre plus longtemps et plus efficacement.
column4: Wenn wir das Beste aus unseren Flugzeugdesigns herausholen möchten, dann müssen wir unsere Piloten ausbilden, zum Beispiel, wie man beim Abfeuern der Bordwaffen Munition sparen kann. Die Jagdpilotenausbildung würde die Reichweite und Kampfeffizienz unserer Jagdflugzeuge erhöhen.
column6: La instrucción de los pilotos es esencial si queremos sacar lo mejor de nuestros diseños aeronáuticos. Incluso las cosas más sencillas, como la instrucción de nuestros pilotos sobre cuándo es mejor disparar para conservar munición, les permitirá sacar lo mejor de nuestros aviones. Esto permitirá que nuestros cazas luchen más tiempo y de manera más eficaz.

column3: L'une des principales missions de nos chasseurs est d'intercepter les avions ennemis entrant dans notre espace aérien. Améliorer notre doctrine tactique permettra à nos chasseurs d'effectuer plus efficacement cette tâche essentielle.
column4: Eine Hauptaufgabe unserer Jagdflugzeuge ist das Abfangen feindlicher Flugzeuge, die in unseren Luftraum fliegen. Die Verbesserung unserer taktischen Doktrin würde bewirken, dass unsere Jagdflugzeuge diese wichtige Aufgabe noch effizienter ausfüllen können.
column6: Una de las principales misiones de nuestros cazas es interceptar la aviación enemiga que accede a nuestro espacio aéreo. Si mejoramos nuestra doctrina táctica, nuestros cazas podrán realizar esta tarea vital con mayor eficacia.

column3: L'une des principales missions de nos avions de soutien aérien rapproché est de frapper les troupes ennemies. Améliorer notre doctrine tactique permettra à nos avions de soutien aérien rapproché d'effectuer plus efficacement cette tâche essentielle.
column4: Eine Hauptaufgabe unserer Schlachtflugzeuge ist der Beschuss feindlicher Bodentruppen. Die Verbesserung unserer taktischen Doktrin würde bewirken, dass unsere Schlachtflugzeuge diese wichtige Aufgabe noch effizienter ausfüllen können.
column6: Una de las principales misiones de nuestros aviones de apoyo aéreo de proximidad es atacar las tropas enemigas. Si mejoramos nuestra doctrina táctica, nuestros aviones de apoyo aéreo de proximidad podrán realizar esta tarea vital con mayor eficacia.

column2: A robot is a mechanical or virtual intelligent agent that can perform tasks automatically or with guidance, typically by remote control. In practice a robot is usually an electro-mechanical machine that is guided by computer and electronic programming. Robots can be autonomous, semi-autonomous or remotely controlled.

The strategy and tactics of guerrilla warfare tend to focus around the use of a small, mobile force competing against a larger, more unwieldy one. The guerrilla focuses on organizing in small units, depending on the support of the local population, as well as taking advantage of terrain more accommodating of small units. actically, the guerrilla army would avoid any confrontation with large units of enemy troops.

No war can truely be won without taking control of land and infantry are at the spearhead of invading forces. For us to be able to defend and invade other territories we need an adequate inantry forces, these are the most basic soldiers but without who no control can be established over a wanted area.

Desert warfare is combat in deserts. In desert warfare the elements can sometimes be more dangerous than the actual enemy. The desert terrain is the second most inhospitable to troops following a cold environment. The low humidity, extremes of heat/cold, and lack of obstacles and wild-life allows the increased use of electronic devices and unmanned aircraft for surveillance and attacks.

The jungle environment has a variety of effects on military operations. Dense vegetation can limit lines of sight and arcs of fire, but can also provide ample opportunity for camouflage and plenty of material with which to build fortifications. Jungle terrain, often without good roads, can be inaccessible to vehicles and so makes supply and transport difficult, which in turn places a premium on air mobility.

Mountain warfare refers to warfare in the mountains or similarly rough terrain. This type of warfare is also called Alpine warfare, named after the Alps mountains. Mountain warfare is one of the most dangerous types of combat as it involves surviving not only combat with the enemy but also the extreme weather and dangerous terrain. Mountain ranges are of strategic importance since they often act as a natural border.

Urban warfare is combat conducted in urban areas such as towns and cities. Urban combat is very different from combat in the open at both the operational and tactical level. Complicating factors in urban warfare include the presence of civilians and the complexity of the urban terrain. Some civilians may be difficult to distinguish from combatants such as armed militias and gangs, and particularly individuals who are simply trying to protect their homes.

Amphibious warfare is the use of naval firepower, logistics and strategy to project military power ashore. In previous eras it stood as the primary method of delivering troops to non-contiguous enemy-held terrain. In this modern era amphibious warfare persists in the form of commando insertion by fast patrol boats, zodiacs and mini-submersibles.

Airborne forces are military units, usually light infantry, set up to be moved by aircraft and 'dropped' into battle. Thus they can be placed behind enemy lines, and have an ability to deploy almost anywhere with little warning. The formations are limited nly by the number and size of their aircraft, so given enough capacity a huge force can appear out of nowhere in minutes, an action referred to as vertical envelopment.
With our infantry having the basic know how of modern combat it is time to turn them into real unstopble war machines, with advanced training they will be even more effective on the battlefield.

Sometimes it is best to fight unconventionally, with small groups of troops roaming through the front lines, avoiding battles and causing mayhem. If our army is prepared for this kind of guerilla warfare, then our units can inflict nasty ambushes on attacking enemies. HQ brigades will also consume fewer supplies.
column3: Parfois le mieux est de combattre d'une manière non conventionnelle en petits groupes parcourant les lignes de front, évitant les combats et semant le trouble. Si notre armée est préparée à ce type de guérilla, nos unités pourront alors tendre d'impitoyables embuscades pendant les attaques ennemies. Les brigades de notre QG consommeront également moins de ravitaillement.
column4: Manchmal ist der unkonventionelle Kampf mit kleinen Kampftruppen, die unter Vermeidung direkter Gefechte durch das Frontgebiet streifen und für Chaos sorgen, der beste Weg zum Erfolg. Wenn unsere Armee für diese Art von Guerilla-Kriegsführung vorbereitet wäre, könnten unsere Einheiten den Feind in blutige Hinterhalte locken. Außerdem würden unsere Kommandobrigaden weniger Nachschub verbrauchen.
column6: En ocasiones, es mejor luchar de forma no convencional, con grupos pequeños de tropas recorriendo las líneas del frente, evitando las batallas y causando problemas. Si tu ejército está listo para este tipo de guerra de guerrillas, nuestras unidades podrán tender peligrosas emboscadas a los enemigos que atacan. Las brigadas del CG también consumirán menos suministros.

column2: In the last war, we made much use of lines of trenches and fixed positions to stop the enemy. Now, by holding the front lines lightly, with reserves sent to stop the enemy when he has committed his troops, we can conduct a more efficient, elastic defence. This means our troops will be more likely to effect a tactical withdrawal when attacked and our HQ brigades will be better organised.
column3: Au cours de la dernière guerre, nous avons bien plus utilisé les lignes de tranchées et les positions fixes pour stopper l'ennemi. Désormais, en allégeant les lignes de front et en envoyant des troupes pour stopper l'ennemi dès qu'il engage ses troupes, nous pourrons mener une défense flexible plus efficace. Ainsi, nos troupes seront plus susceptibles d'effectuer un repli tactique lorsqu'elles sont attaquées et les brigades de notre QG seront mieux organisées.
column4: Im 1. Weltkrieg haben wir uns zum Aufhalten des Feindes meistens auf Schützengräben und feste Stellungen gestützt. Mittlerweile können wir eine flexiblere Verteidigungsmethode einsetzen, die auf dem Vorhadensein von Reserven aufbaut. Dies bedeutet, dass unsere Truppen den angreifenden Feind mit größerer Wahrscheinlichkeit zum taktischen Rückzug zwingen können und dass unsere Kommandobrigaden besser organisiert sind.
column6: Durante la última guerra, hicimos buen uso de las líneas de trincheras y posiciones fijas para detener al enemigo. Ahora, con unas líneas de frente más flexibles y reservas enviadas para interceptar al enemigo cuando compromete a sus tropas, podemos llevar una defensa elástica mucho más eficaz. Con ello nuestras tropas tendrán más probabilidades de realizar una retirada táctica cuando sean atacadas, y nuestras brigadas del CG estarán mejor organizadas.

column2: If our army depends on masses of ill-prepared troops, it is vital that as many reach the front as possible. This requires our staff officers and logistics experts to reconsider a number of their assumptions. But if we do it, the result will be that militia and partisan units will be more effective in combat, because they will take up less combat width.
column3: Si notre armée dépend d'une énorme quantité de troupes mal préparées, il est essentiel qu'un maximum d'entre elles atteigne le front. Pour cela, il faudra que nos officiers d'état-major et que nos experts en logistique revoient un certain nombre de leurs estimations. Mais, si nous procédons de la sorte, cela permettra à nos unités de milice et de partisans d'être plus efficaces au combat parce qu'elles occuperont moins d'espace sur l'aire de combat.
column4: Wenn sich unsere Armee auf Massen von schlecht ausgebildeten Truppen stützt, ist es unerlässlich, dass wir so viele Einheiten wie möglich an die Front bringen. Dies erfordert, dass unsere Stabsoffiziere und Logistikexperten eine Reihe ihrer Vermutungen überdenken müssen. Die Übernahme dieser Doktrin würde bedeuten, dass unsere Miliz- und Partisaneneinheiten kampfeffizienter wären, da sie weniger Kampfbreite einnähmen.
column6: Si tu ejército depende de masas de tropas mal entrenadas, es esencial que el mayor número alcance el frente. Esto requiere que nuestros oficiales del estado mayor y expertos en logística reconsideren algunas de sus ideas preconcebidas. Pero, si lo hacemos, nuestras milicias y unidades de partisanos serán más eficaces en combate porque usarán menos anchura de combate.

column2: The new weapons of armoured warfare require new methods. Warfare is now mobile, with fronts moving more in a day than they once did in a year. Understanding this better will mean our troops are more likely to exploit the  breakthroughs they make, and our HQ brigades will move faster.
column3: Les nouvelles armes utilisées lors de la guerre blindée nécessiteront de nouvelles méthodes. La guerre est désormais une guerre de mouvement pendant laquelle les fronts se déplacent plus en un jour qu'ils le faisaient en un an. En comprenant mieux cela, nos troupes exploiteront plus certainement les percées qu'elles feront et les brigades de notre QG se déplaceront plus rapidement.
column4: Die neuen Waffen der mobilen Kriegsführung erfordern neue Kampfmethoden. Der Krieg ist nun mobil, und die Fronten können sich an einem Tag mehr verschieben als früher in einem ganzen Jahr. Besseres Verständnis der mobilen Kriegsführung würde bedeuten, dass unsere Truppen erzielte Durchbrüche besser ausnutzen und unsere Kommandobrigaden schneller vorrücken könnten.
column6: Las nuevas armas de la guerra acorazada requieren nuevos métodos. La guerra es ahora móvil, con frentes que varían más en un día que antes en un año. Una profunda comprensión de esto supondrá que nuestras tropas podrán explotar mejor las brechas que abran, y nuestras brigadas del CG se moverán más deprisa.

column2: Often it is vital to hold up an enemy advance as long as possible while our commanders respond to events. Focusing our officers on this will make it more likely that our units can slow the enemy down when attacked.
column3: Il est souvent essentiel de freiner la progression d'un ennemi aussi longtemps que possible, le temps que nos commandants réagissent aux événements. Si nos officiers se concentrent sur cela, nos unités seront plus susceptibles de ralentir l'ennemi lorsqu'elles sont attaquées.
column4: Oftmals ist es lebenswichtig, einen feindlichen Vorstoß so lange wie möglich aufzuhalten, damit unsere Kommandeure Gegenmaßnahmen ergreifen können. Wenn wir unsere Offiziere hierauf konzentrieren, werden unsere Einheiten feindliche Angriffe mit größerer Wahrscheinlichkeiten verlangsamen können.
column6: A menudo es esencial contener un avance enemigo el tiempo que sea posible mientras nuestros comandantes responden a los acontecimientos. Si centramos a nuestros oficiales en esta tarea, nuestras unidades tendrán más probabilidades de ralentizar al enemigo cuando sean atacadas.

column2: Even a well prepared enemy can be overwhelmed by a massed attack which offers him too many targets to deal with. If our units become used to attacking in overwhelming numbers like this, they will suffer less of a penalty for having many divisions in the same province.
column3: Même un ennemi bien préparé peut être submergé par une attaque massive lui donnant trop de cibles à gérer. Si nos unités s'habituent à attaquer l'ennemi de cette manière en le submergeant par le nombre, elles subiront moins de pénalités liées à un trop grand nombre de divisions présentes dans une même province.
column4: Selbst ein gut vorbereiter Gegner kann durch einen Massenangriff überwältigt werden, der ihm zu viele Ziele bietet. Wenn sich unsere Einheiten daran gewöhnen, in derartigen Massen anzugreifen, würden sie weniger Abzüge erleiden, wenn sich viele Divisionen in derselben Provinz befänden.
column6: Incluso un ejército bien preparado puede ser aplastado por un ataque en masa que le ponga delante demasiados objetivos entre los que elegir. Si nuestras unidades se acostumbran a atacar en números ingentes,sufrirán menos penalizaciones por tener demasiadas divisiones en la misma provincia.

column2: During the last war, we relied on the morale of our infantry to seize the objectives. It is a much more efficient way of fighting if the enemy has already been defeated by our firepower before the infantry advances. Adopting this doctrine will mean we can put additional brigades in our divisions to make sure we have superior firepower.
column3: Au cours de la dernière guerre, nous comptions sur le moral de notre infanterie pour atteindre les objectifs. Il est bien plus efficace de combattre si l'ennemi a déjà été vaincu par notre puissance de feu avant que l'infanterie progresse. Adopter cette doctrine nous permettra d'ajouter des brigades supplémentaires à nos divisions pour garantir que nous ayons la puissance de feu dominante.
column4: Während des letzten Krieges verließen wir uns zum Erreichen von Einsatzzielen auf die Moral unserer Infanterie. Eine weitaus bessere Gefechtstaktik ist es jedoch, den Feind mit Hilfe unserer Feuerkraft vor dem eigentlichen Vorstoß der Infanterie zu besiegen. Durch die Übernahme dieser Doktrin würden wir zur Steigerung unserer Feuerkraft zusätzliche Brigaden in unsere Divisionen integrieren können.
column6: Durante la última guerra, la moral de la infantería dependía de su tamaño y de los objetivos. Es una manera mucho más eficaz si el enemigo ya ha sido derrotado por nuestra potencia de fuego antes del avance de la infantería. La adopción de esta doctrina significará que podremos añadir más brigadas a nuestras divisiones para asegurarnos de que tenemos más potencia de fuego.

column2: With motorised and mechanised infantry units, we can conduct offensives far more quickly and powerfully than before. However, this requires specialised training, and total co-operation between riflemen and their vehicles. Making this part of the training regime will mean our mechanised and motorised brigades are more organised and effective in combat.
column3: Grâce aux unités d'infanterie motorisée et mécanisée, nous pourrons mener des offensives plus puissantes et plus rapides. Cependant, cela nécessite un entraînement spécialisé et une totale coopération entre les fusiliers et leurs véhicules. Effectuer cette partie de l'entraînement permettra à nos brigades mécanisées et motorisées d'être plus organisées et plus efficaces au combat.
column4: Mit motorisierten und mechanisierten Infanterieeinheiten können wir Offensiven schneller und stärker als zuvor vorbringen. Dies erfordert jedoch die Spezialausbildung und totale Kooperation der Infanteristen mit ihren Fahrzeugen. Wenn wir ihre Ausbildung auf diesen Aspekt konzentrieren würden, könnten unsere mechanisierten und motorisierten Brigaden im Kampf organisierter und effizienter auftreten.
column6: Con unidades motorizadas y mecanizadas, podemos realizar ofensivas de forma mucho más rápida y contundente que antes. Aun así, esto requiere instrucción especializada y la total colaboración entre los fusileros y sus vehículos. Si sumamos esto a nuestro régimen de instrucciones, nuestras brigadas mecanizadas y motorizadas estarán mucho mejor organizadas y serán más eficaces en combate.

column3: Pour qu'une armée soit efficace en situation de combat, toutes les unités doivent travailler ensemble d'après un plan précis. L'utilisation d'un contrôle centralisé de toutes les unités préconisé par notre doctrine augmentera nos chances de contre-attaque les offensives ennemies et rendra nos brigades plus résistantes lorsqu'elles attaqueront.
column4: Zur effizienten Gefechtsleistung einer Armee müssen alle Einheiten zusammen nach einem klar strukturierten Plan handeln. Wenn wir die zentrale Kontrolle aller Einheiten zu unserer Doktrin machen würden, wären die Chancen für Gegenangriffe auf feindliche Attacken größer, außerdem würde unsere Kommandobrigade in der Offensive forscher vorgehen.
column6: Para que un ejército sea eficaz en condiciones de batalla, cada unidad debe colaborar para cumplir un plan claro. Si adoptamos la doctrina de la centralización del control de todas las unidades, tendremos más probabilidades de contraatacar al enemigo y dar mayor dureza a nuestras brigadas durante las ofensivas.

L'utilisation d'un contrôle centralisé de toutes les unités préconisé par notre doctrine augmentera nos chances de contre-attaque les offensives ennemies et rendra nos brigades plus résistantes lorsqu'elles attaqueront.
